engineeringConcepts: Primitives vs object wrappers (int vs Integer)
Clean variable naming — avoid redundant context
No implicit type conversion (int to BigDecimal)

history: Boolean vs boolean — took 3 reminders to stick
AND vs && — Apex/SOQL habit carried over
Passing int where BigDecimal expected — type safety
Calling instance methods without the instance reference

conceptsMapped: Platform-managed runtime → you own the JVM
Tests in same folder → tests in separate src/test tree
Apex Integer (always object) → Java int (primitive) vs Integer (object)
Single quotes for strings → double quotes only (single = char)
Apex switch on → Java switch expression (returns a value)
surprises: No platform to push to — you run the app yourself
JAR needs a manifest to know its entry point
Java has primitives — Apex hides them from you
Local variables have no default value — must initialize
Switch can produce a value — Apex switch cannot
Can't switch on BigDecimal — must convert to String/enum first
